cards.text: well... <pronounSubjective> has been feeding me goddamn lies!
from my experience I can tell you: Never lend money to <aan> <noun> while blackout drunk.
I didn't want to hang <pronounObjective> but <pronounSubjective> left me no choice!
I made a pie out of <pronounObjective>. It contained a small amount of nuts.
and for the record: I love <pronounObjective>.
<pronounSubjective> told me: "You son of a gun! You did it!"
I took <pronounObjective> and threw <pronounObjective> of <pronounPossessive> favorite bridge in Downtown, Atlanta
I always say "It could be worse" you know?
The moral of the story? Never challenge <aan> <noun> to a fist fight.
because I just looove the taste of <noun> in the morning!
but I mean what is worse? Or bad case of diarrhea or <aan> <adjective> <noun>?
And I think it is not a good idea, but it just works!
